results.title: The Fight game
results.creator_credit: Forum Films and March of Time, Inc.
results.brief_description: A survey of boxing from the days when the rules were first formalised, to the present use of boxing by groups working wiht boys to give them healthful recreation and to channel their energies away from socially destructive practices. Includes scenes of Gane, Nelson, Dempsey, Tunney and Louis. The film closes with an examination of racketeering and other ills afflicting the sport and their possible cure.

results.title: Fight for the Ashes
results.brief_description: Gives a coverage of the 1953 test cricket series between Australia and England with highlights of play in each match. Concludes with congratulatory speeches by the captains of the opposing teams.

results.title: Fight for a fuller life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”.
A survey of the educational facilities available to the British citizen. The examination begins with the Universities: increased attendance, coupled with a shortage of accommodation, has created a situation in which professors and tutors have less time for research and personal tuition so vital to university life. The film also discusses the technical training colleges and the facilities provided by the local authorities for vocational training. The last secion deals with adult education and the organisations that are responsible for the provision of expert tuition in a wide variety of subjects.

results.title: Fight for a city
results.creator_credit: Manu Simon, Belgian Television and Unesco
results.brief_description: In 1957, Brussels caught the modern fever - it wanted to be like all other big cities in the world. This meant replacing the old city areas with concrete and glass. Many local residents opposed these plans and did not want to be re-housed, so they formed themselves into committees. Following protests from some committees the authorities decided to take a new look at their plans. In 1969 a local committee waged a well-organized combat against an urban policy - it was called The battle for the Marolles and the residents celebrated their victory with a big open-air party. Many other committees were formed after this success.

results.title: The Fight continues
results.creator_credit: Vaclav Bedrich, Czechoslovak Film and World Health Organisation

results.title: Fifty-four forty south
results.brief_description: A New Zealand naval vessel takes meteorologists and scientific observers to the Campbell and Macquarie Islands in the South Polar Seas. Nature interest of bird and animal life - albatrosses, penguins, sea lions and sea elephants.

results.title: Fifth report on modernisation
results.brief_description: An account of recent progress in research, development and design under British Railways modernisation programme. Ingenious new types of equipment, modern maintenance depots, new building techniques for passenger and goods trains, up to date communications systems, main line electrification and research into metal fatigue and wheel adhesion are described.

results.title: Fifth of despair
results.brief_description: Discusses the disease of alcoholism and the necessary procedures in treatment of the problem. Looks at programmes in the United States which are involved in rehabilitation and treatment of alcoholics. Among many organisations attempting to solve the problem are the A.A., Salvation Army and numerous honour ranches.
